newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk prosecutors seek religious foundation closure.
newsitem.headline: Turk prosecutors seek religious foundation closure.

text.p: Turkish prosecutors on Thursday took steps to close an Islamic foundation and try five of its directors, in a further sign of a secularist crackdown on religious activism.
State-run Anatolian news agency said five directors of the Unity Foundation were charged in a state security court with giving financial assistance to outlawed Islamist groups.
The directors face between 4.5 and 7.5 years in prison if found guilty. Prosecutors have also called for the foundation to be closed and its assets seized.
The charges said mail intercepted leaving the foundation contained money intended for imprisoned radical Islamists.
Top members of Turkey's judiciary on Tuesday attended a packed briefing on religious activism by the powerful military, defying the Islamist justice minister's order to stay away.

A battle between the secular establishment and Islamists has convulsed Turkey since the arrival in office last June of its first Islamist prime minister, Necmettin Erbakan. The row has brought his coalition to the point of collapse.
